subject: Critical Thinking
title: Everyday Logic: Spotting Bad Arguments at Work
description: A 60-second lesson on Everyday Logic: Spotting Bad Arguments at Work.

hook.text: 'We've always done it this way.' That's not an argument ‚Äî it's a refusal to think. And it's everywhere.

buildup.text: Workplaces run on informal logic: proposals, justifications, cost-benefit claims, risk assessments.

discovery.text: Most bad business decisions come from hidden assumptions nobody questioned, not from bad data.

twist.text: The most powerful question in any meeting: 'What would have to be true for this to be wrong?'

climax.text: Asking for evidence, checking assumptions, and naming trade-offs ‚Äî that's logic without formulas.

punchline.text: You don't need symbols. You need the habit of asking 'why?'

quiz.question: What is the most common source of bad business decisions?
